com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler

Class ArkoiCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.ArkoiCompiler

  • public class ArkoiCompiler
extends java.lang.Object
    The ArkoiCompiler class is used for compiling multiple files. It also contains some useful methods for debugging etc. To start the compiling process you just need to call the compile() method and so every file is getting compiled.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ArkoiClass> arkoiClasses
      This HashMap contains every ArkoiClass with the canonical path as a key.
      private java.lang.String workingDirectory
      The working directory is specified with a String and is used to declare the workstation of the compiler.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ArkoiCompiler(java.lang.String workingDirectory)
      Constructs an ArkoiCompiler with the given parameters.

    • Field Detail

      • arkoiClasses

        @Expose
private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,ArkoiClass> arkoiClasses
        This HashMap contains every ArkoiClass with the canonical path as a key. You can use it to search a specified file or getting all ArkoiClass's inside it.

      • workingDirectory

        @Expose
private final java.lang.String workingDirectory
        The working directory is specified with a String and is used to declare the workstation of the compiler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArkoiCompiler

        public ArkoiCompiler(java.lang.String workingDirectory)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs an ArkoiCompiler with the given parameters. It will set the workstation for the compiler workingDirectory and also initializes itself with all natives files found (addNativeFiles()).
        Parameters:
        workingDirectory - the workstation for the compiler which is declared through a String.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something with the natives went wrong.

    • Method Detail

      • addFile

        public void addFile(java.io.File file)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Adds the specified file to the arkoiClasses map and creates a new ArkoiClass.
        Parameters:
        file - the file which is used to get the canonical path and the content of it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something went wrong during the reading of all bytes inside the file.

      • printStackTrace

        public void printStackTrace(java.io.PrintStream errorStream)
        Prints a StackTrace of the current errors and writes it to the given PrintStream. This method is used if an error occurred or something went wrong.
        Parameters:
        errorStream - the PrintStream which is used to print the StackTrace.

      • compile

        public boolean compile()
        The main method of this whole class. It will initialize every stage of the given ArkoiClass's and tries to proceed them. If something doesn't work the AbstractStage.processStage() method will return false and so the compile() method too. This will indicate that an error occurred.
        Returns:
        true if everything worked correctly or false if an error occurred.

      • addNativeFiles

        private void addNativeFiles()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Adds every native file to the compilation task which are inside the native directory. It will throw an error if the native directory doesn't exits or an error occurred during the process of reading the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the native directory doesn't exists or an error occurred during the reading of the file.

      • findNativeSemanticFunction

        public FunctionDefinitionSemanticAST findNativeSemanticFunction(java.lang.String functionDescription)
        Finds a native FunctionDefinitionSemanticAST by the given function description. It will skip every non-native ArkoiClass and will return null, if no FunctionDefinitionSemanticAST was found.
        Parameters:
        functionDescription - the function description which is used to find the FunctionDefinitionSemanticAST.
        Returns:
        the found FunctionDefinitionSemanticAST or null if there doesn't exists any native functions with the same description.
